intro: Asemeia leiodes, commonly known as the narrow-leafed asemeia, is a flowering plant native to the United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Asemeia leiodes thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. It plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its habitat.
